---
output:
  word_document:
    reference_docx: anGBtemplate.docx
params:
  GBpopdat: ''
  AOInm: ''
  photofn: ''
  EVALIDator_match: TRUE
  popfilter: ''
  photo_author: ''
  title.ref: ''
  
---


```{r Data_Inputs, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}

GBpopdat <- params$GBpopdat
AOInm <- params$AOInm
EVALIDator_match <- params$EVALIDator_match
popfilter <- params$popfilter
photo_author <- params$photo_author
photofn <- params$photofn
title.ref <- params$title.ref

invyrs <- unlist(GBpopdat$invyrs)
invyrs2 <- paste0(min(invyrs), "-", max(invyrs))
states <- GBpopdat$states

if (is.null(title.ref)) {
  title.ref <- AOInm
}

title.states <- paste(states, collapse=" and ")

```


---
title: "Forest Resource Report: \n `r AOInm`, `r title.states`, \n  `r invyrs2`"
---

# Summary

&nbsp;  

```{r Summary_Info, echo=FALSE, include=FALSE}

estsummary <- modGBarea(GBpopdat=GBpopdat, rowvar="COND_STATUS_CD", row.FIAname=TRUE, 
                rawdata=TRUE, landarea="ALL", colvar="RESERVCD", col.FIAname=TRUE)

rowest <- estsummary$raw$rowest
colest <- estsummary$raw$colest

title.rowvar <- "Land class"
title.colvar <- "Reserved status"
totarea=sum(GBpopdat$unitarea$ACRES)
area.for <- rowest[rowest[[title.rowvar]] == "Forest land", "est"]
area.nf <- rowest[rowest[[title.rowvar]] == "Nonforest land", "est"]
area.water <- sum(rowest[rowest[[title.rowvar]] %in% c("Noncensus water", "Census water"), "est"])

if (!EVALIDator_match) {
summary_text <-
paste0("Estimates are calculated using the Forest Inventory ESTimation and Analysis (FIESTA) R package (Frescino et al. 2015) and are based on FIA's standard 'Green Book' estimators (Bechtold and Patterson, 2005). Data for this report are from the Forest Inventory and Analysis (FIA) database for years ", invyrs2, ". All estimation percent sampling errors are reported 68% confidence level.")
} else {
addtext <- "The estimates are based on state-level population data"
if (is.null(popfilter) || popfilter == "") {
addtext <- paste0(addtext, ". ")
} else {
addtext <- paste0(addtext, ", filtered by ", popfilter, ". ")
}
summary_text <-
paste0("Estimates are calculated using the Forest Inventory ESTimation and Analysis (FIESTA) R package (Frescino et al. 2015) and are based on FIA's standard 'Green Book' estimators (Bechtold and Patterson, 2005). Data for this report are from the Forest Inventory and Analysis (FIA) database for years ", invyrs2, ". ", addtext, "All estimation percent sampling errors are reported 68% confidence level.")
}


unitvars <- c(GBpopdat$unitvar, GBpopdat$unitvars)
stratalut <- setDT(GBpopdat$stratalut)
nplots <- sum(stratalut[, sum(n.total, na.rm=TRUE), by=unitvars][["V1"]])

```


The area of `r params$AOInm` located in `r title.states`, is `r format(round(totarea), big.mark=",")` acres with `r round(area.for/totarea * 100)` percent of the area classified as forest land, `r round(area.nf/totarea * 100)` percent classified as nonforest land, and `r round(area.water/totarea * 100)` percent as water. There are a total of `r format(nplots, big.mark=",")` FIA plots within the population. 

&nbsp;  

`r summary_text`

# EST1 - Number of live trees (>= 1.0 in dia) per acre by forest type group table.


-----  


Table 1. Number of live trees (>= 1.0 in dia) per acre by forest type group, `r AOInm`, `r title.states`, `r invyrs2`.

&nbsp;    

```{r EST1_Table, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}

estdat_EST1 <- modGBratio(GBpopdat=GBpopdat, landarea="FOREST", 
		cfilter="ADFORCD == 408", estvarn="TPA_UNADJ", 
		estvarn.filter="STATUSCD == 1 & DIA >= 1.0", 
		rowvar="FORTYPGRPCD", row.FIAname=TRUE,
		rawdata=TRUE, returntitle=TRUE, estround=2, pseround=0,
		title.filter="Fishlake National Forest" )

estdat_EST1_raw_rowest <- estdat_EST1$raw$rowest

EST1 <- subset(estdat_EST1_raw_rowest, select=c("Forest-type group", "rhat", "pse"))

EST1 <- setnames(EST1, c("Forest-Type Group", "Estimate", "Percent Sampling Error"))

knitr::kable(EST1, "simple", align=c("lrr"), digits=c(0,2,0),
             format.args=list(big.mark = ","))

```  

&nbsp;

anMOD_barplot(estdat_EST1, barplot.row=TRUE, barplot.nplt=TRUE, barplot.ord=NULL)

# EST9_v1 - Acres of forestland by stand age up to 100 years in 20 year interval classes table.


----- 


Table 11. Acres of forestland by stand age up to 100 years in 20 year interval classes, `r AOInm`, `r title.states`, `r invyrs2`.

&nbsp;  

```{r EST9_v1_Table, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}

MIN_EST9_v1 <- c(0, 21, 41, 61, 81, 101)
MAX_EST9_v1 <- c(20.9, 40.9, 60.9, 80.9, 100.9, 9999)
STDAGENM_EST9_v1 <- c("0-20", "21-40", "41-60", "61-80", "81-100", "100+")
stdagelut_EST9_v1 <- data.frame(MIN=MIN_EST9_v1, MAX=MAX_EST9_v1, STDAGENM=STDAGENM_EST9_v1)

datlut_EST9_v1 <- datLUTclass(x=GBpopdat$pltcondx, xvar="STDAGE",LUT=stdagelut_EST9_v1, LUTclassnm="STDAGENM") 

GBpopdat$pltcondx <- datlut_EST9_v1$xLUT

estdat_EST9_v1 <- modGBarea(GBpopdat=GBpopdat, landarea="FOREST", 
		cfilter="ADFORCD == 408",	rowvar="STDAGENM",
		rawdata=TRUE, returntitle=TRUE, estround=2, pseround=0,
		title.rowvar="stand age class",	title.filter="Fishlake National Forest",
		divideby="thousand")

estdat_EST9_v1_raw_rowest <- estdat_EST9_v1$raw$rowest

EST9_v1 <- subset(estdat_EST9_v1_raw_rowest, select=c("stand age class", "est", "pse"))

EST9_v1 <- setnames(EST9_v1, c("Stand Age Class", "Estimate", "Percent Sampling Error"))

knitr::kable(EST9_v1, "simple", align=c("lll"), digits=c(0,2,0),
             format.args = list(big.mark = ","))

```
